1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing of 

Drivers) (Amendment) Regulations 2025.

title: conferred on me by sections 5(1), 22, 23(2), 35 and 42 of the Road Traffic Act
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 19 May 2025.
text_raw: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 19 May 2025.

title: conferred on me by sections 5(1), 22, 23(2), 35 and 42 of the Road Traffic Act
heading: 3. The Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537
text_raw:
3. The Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537 

of 2006) are amended – 

(a) 

in Regulation 3(1), by the insertion of the following definitions: 

“ ‘Act of 1956’ means Irish Nationality and Citizenship Act 1956 
(No. 26 of 1956); 

‘Act of 2010’ means Social Welfare and Pensions Act 2010 (No. 
37 of 2010); 

‘Act of 2015’ means International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66 of 
2015);”, 

(b) 

in Regulation 12, by the insertion of the following paragraph after 
paragraph (4): 

“(4A) An application for a driving licence made on or after 
19 May 2025 shall be accompanied by evidence that the applicant 
has a legal right to reside in the State specified in Regulation 
54A.”, 

(c) 

by the insertion of the following regulation after Regulation 14: 

“Revocation of driving licence – expiry of right to reside in 
State 

14A. (1) Where a person provides a document specified in 
Regulation 54A(1)(i) with his or her application for a licence, as 
evidence that he or she has a legal right to reside in the State, and 
such document expires, the licence shall, subject to paragraph (2), 
stand revoked – 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 16th May, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [193] 3 

(a) where the document expires after the second 
anniversary of the grant of the licence, on the 
day 30 days after the date of such expiration, or, 

(b) where the document expires before the second 
anniversary of the grant of the licence, on the 
day 30 days after the second anniversary of the 
grant of the licence. 

(2) Where, during the period of 30 days referred to in 
paragraph (1) the applicant provides the licensing authority with 
evidence specified in Regulation 54A that he or she has, at that 
time, a legal right to reside in the State that evidence shall be 
deemed to be evidence provided by the person with his or her 
application for an Irish driving licence. 

Revocation of driving licence – failure to meet requirements 
or fraud 

14B. (1) Where, after a driving licence is granted, the licensing 
authority determines that any document provided with the 
application was, at the time of the application, invalid or no longer 
in force or was or is false or misleading in any material respect 
the licensing authority shall notify the licence holder at his or her 
last known address. 

(2) Where the licensing authority notifies a licence holder in 
accordance with paragraph (1) the licence shall stand revoked on 
the date on which the Minister notifies the holder of the Irish 
driving licence.”, 

(d) 

in Regulation 19(3), by the insertion of “that was not revoked 
the date of 
under Regulation 21A(2)” after “preceding 
application”, 

(e) 

in Regulation 20, by the insertion of the following paragraph after 
paragraph (5): 

“(5A) 

An application for a learner permit made on or 
after 19 May 2025 shall be accompanied by evidence that the 
applicant has a legal right to reside in the State specified in 
Regulation 54A.”, 

(f) 

by the insertion of the following regulation after Regulation 21: 

“Revocation of learner permit – failure to meet requirements 
or fraud 

21A. (1) Where, after a learner permit is granted, the licensing 
authority determines that any document provided with the 
application for the permit was, at the time of the application, 
invalid or no longer in force or is or was false or misleading in 
any material respect the licensing authority shall notify the permit 
holder at his or her last known address. 

(2) Where the licensing authority notifies a permit holder in 
accordance with paragraph (1) the permit shall stand revoked on 

 4 [193] 

the date on which the Minister notifies the holder of the learner 
permit.”, 

(g) 

in Regulation 27(1), by the insertion of “other than a licence 
revoked under Regulation 14B(2)” after “the holder of a driving 
licence”, 

(h) by the substitution of the following table for the table to 

Regulation 32(2)(b): 

“ 

TABLE 

Code 

Additional information/restrictions 

(1) 

01 

02 

(2) 

Sight correction and / or protection 

Hearing aid / communication aid 

03 

Prosthesis / orthosis for the limbs 

61 

Limited to day time journeys 

62(30) Limited to journeys within a radius of 30 km 

from holder’s place of residence 

63 

Limited to driving without passengers 

64(80) Limited to journeys with a speed not greater 

than 80 km/h 

65 

Limited to driving solely when accompanied 

by a holder of a driving licence of at least the 

equivalent category 

66 

Limited to driving without trailer 

67 

Not permitted to drive on motorways 

 [193] 5 

68 

Limited to driving without alcohol 

69 

Restricted to driving vehicles equipped with 

an alcohol interlock in accordance with EN 

50463 

70 

Exchange of recognised driving licence 

71 

Duplicate licence 

79 

Restricted to vehicles which comply with the 

specifications indicated in brackets

”
, 

and 

(i) 

by the insertion of the following regulation after Regulation 54: 

“Evidence of legal right to reside in the State 

54A. (1) Each of the following shall be evidence that a person 
has a legal right to reside in the State for the purposes of an 
application for an Irish driving licence or a learner permit: 

(a) where the applicant is the holder of a current 
public services card (within the meaning given 
to it by section 263(1) (inserted by section 9(1) 
of the Act of 2010) of the Social Welfare 
Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005) and 
the applicant’s nationality, as contained in the 
card, is of a member state of the European 

 8 [193] 

Union or the European Economic Area or of 
Switzerland or the United Kingdom, such 
public services card; 

(b) where the applicant was born before 1 January 
2005, a birth certificate or an adoption 
certificate showing the applicant’s place of 
birth to be in Ireland; 

(c) where the applicant was born before 1 January 
1983, a birth certificate or an adoption 
certificate showing the applicant’s place of 
birth to be in the United Kingdom; 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

a document 
the applicant 
in respect of 
purporting to be a copy of an entry in a foreign 
births entry book or in the foreign births 
register, both of which are kept under section 
27 of the Act of 1956, and which is duly 
authenticated as such; 

a certificate of naturalisation issued under the 
Act of 1956; 

an Irish passport or passport card in respect of 
the applicant (current or expired by no more 
than 12 months); 

a current passport issued in respect of the 
applicant by a member state of the European 
Union or the European Economic Area or by 
Switzerland or the United Kingdom and which 
is valid for international use; 

a current national identity card issued in respect 
of the applicant by a member state of the 
European Union or the European Economic 
Area or by Switzerland; 

(i) when presented with a current passport valid for 
international use issued in respect of the 
applicant or with a current public services card 
(within the meaning given to it by section 
263(1) (inserted by section 9(1) of the Act of 
2010) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 
2005 (No. 26 of 2005)) in respect of the 
applicant – 

(i) 

a registration certificate issued under 
section 9 of the Immigration Act 2004 
(No. 1 of 2004) which has not expired on 
the date of the application; 

(ii) 

a temporary residence certificate given to 
the applicant under section 17 of the Act 

 [193] 9 

of 2015 which is valid on the date of the 
application; 

(iii) a permission to reside in the State given 
to the applicant under section 60(6) of the 
Act of 2015 which is valid on the date of 
the application.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 May, 2025. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 
Minister for Transport.

title: conferred on me by sections 5(1), 22, 23(2), 35 and 42 of the Road Traffic Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the revocation of driving licences and learner 
permits where they have been obtained fraudulently or where certain residence 
documents expire. 

 
 
 
 
 [193] 11
